name: SEER Mets
title: SEER Mets
notes:
**Note 1:**  The lesser sac of the peritoneum, or omental bursa, is the cavity in the abdomen formed by the lesser and greater omentum; the pancreas forms part of the posterior wall of the lesser sac.

**Note 2:**  Celiac axis and splenic nodes are classified as distant and are now coded in SEER Mets.
footnotes:
\## Considered regional in Historic Stage
\** Considered regional in 1977 Summary Staging Guide
